title: Divorce Question: Do I write "unknown" as the amount on the FL 160?
question: Hello, I'm an attorney handling my own divorce because I'm broke and battling cancer.
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Divorce decree,Alimony,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and alimony,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Lawsuits and disputes,Family law,Discovery,Fees
answers: You want to list as much as possible. If you can't list the specific amounts but know the account numbers, list your best estimate with the account number. Example: "Estimate - 30,000, Vanguard account ending in xxxx." If you don't have a clue, put "Unknown."

Just put “unknown” in husband’s control.

I hope this is helpful.

You can always estimate the value of the asset or the amount of the debt subject to your filing of a Final Declaration of Disclosure. Suggest you make an attachement to the FL-142 as part of your Preliminary Declaration of Disclosure that you must serve on the other party within 60 days of service of the petition. But, are there assets that can be liquidated to pay for fees? If so, then an RFO for an asset to be allocated for fees should also be filed. And if your ex has his own attorney, then there is probably enough income to also use this as an order for attorney fees. Discovery of assets is part of the discovery process, though so your PDD is key but the FDD is where you can get a better statement as to the total value of all assets and liabilities.

The purpose of these forms is to put the other party on notice of the existence of assets and debts. Any assets or debts that are not disclosed and are later found out could be grounds to amend the judgment, being "omitted assets."

Many times, values are approximated. More often, though, they are taken from a recent account statement.

In the situation that you describe, you are under no duty to provide information to which you are not privy. You could either list it, putting your husband on notice that you're aware of this, or not list is and see if he bothers to disclose it. If he fails to disclose it and you later get your hands on proof of its existence, you could potentially use this to impeach his credibility.
